definition: abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.chinese: 此外，二维码还有其他不足之处。

sentences.english: A two dimensional code (1232) is positioned on the housing.
You can also share your contact information with other through QR codes.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以通过二维码与他人共享你的联系人信息。

sentences.english: If the two-dimensional code is stuck, be sure to raise vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 如果二维码是粘上去的，务必提高警惕。

sentences.english: One question I do have is this: why use QR codes?
sentences.chinese: 问题是为什么要使用二维码？

definition: to scan a QR code or barcode
Weixin or WeChat (mobile text and voice messaging service developed by Tencent 騰訊|腾讯[Teng2 xun4])
to hit/to press/to strike (on the keyboard)/to click (a web page button)
the top of the page/(word processing) page header
underneath/below/the underside/world of mortals/to descend to the world of mortals (of Gods)
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
